selected_quotes: #RNATherapeutics: Delivering RNA into Cells Perspective by StevenDowdy
Learning how to overcome cellular barriers for #RNA-based therapeutics
Highly insightful+entertaining RNA delivery review by Dowdy available free online. Enjoy
Overcoming cellular barriers for RNA therapeutics : Nature Biotechnology : Nature Research
Cell membranes work hard to keep foreign DNA/RNA out. We use #Aptamer-targeted delivery to get them in. Review of progress…

citation.abstract: RNA-based therapeutics, such as small-interfering (siRNAs), microRNAs (miRNAs), antisense oligonucleotides (ASOs), aptamers, synthetic mRNAs and CRISPR-Cas9, have great potential to target a large part of the currently undruggable genes and gene products and to generate entirely new therapeutic paradigms in disease, ranging from cancer to pandemic influenza to Alzheimer's disease. However, for these RNA modalities to reach their full potential, they first need to overcome a billion years of evolutionary defenses that have kept RNAs on the outside of cells from invading the inside of cells. Overcoming the lipid bilayer to deliver RNA into cells has remained the major problem to solve for widespread development of RNA therapeutics, but recent chemistry advances have begun to penetrate this evolutionary armor.
citation.title: Overcoming cellular barriers for RNA therapeutics
